results.deck: Arcade USA is a Bowling game created by Phoenix Games.
results.name: Arcade USA

results.deck: Azumi is a Beat-'Em Up game created by ESP Software.
results.name: Azumi

results.deck: 21 Card Games by Mere Mortals
results.name: 21 Card Games

results.deck: Family friendly Lord of the Rings game focusing on Aragorn.
results.name: The Lord of the Rings: Aragorn's Quest

results.deck: Game page for a game in te Buzz! Junior series. It's a collection of Buzz minigames.
results.name: Buzz! Junior: Monster Rumble

results.deck: Music Karaoke game. A party game with songs from the Swedish Song Contest.
results.name: SingStar Svenska Hits Schlager

results.deck: Crash 'n' Burn is a PS2 and Xbox racing game which focuses on doing anything necessary to win the race. The game features a sophisticated damage system, and up to 16 cars playing at once online.
results.name: Crash 'n' Burn

results.deck: The first game in the Memories Off franchise is an interactive visual novel.
results.name: Memories Off

results.deck: The third game in the Memories Off franchise.
results.name: Omoide ni Kawaru-Kun: Memories Off

results.deck: Fighting game with the characters of the anime Saiyuki
results.name: Saiyuki Reload Gunlock

results.deck: An role-playing game based on the Saiyuki Reload anime and manga series.
results.name: Saiyuki Reload

results.deck: A cel-shaded fighter based in the Shaman King universe.
results.name: Shaman King: Funbari Spirits

results.deck: Play the story of D.Gray-man in this action-adventure game.
results.name: D.Gray-man: Sousha no Shikaku

results.deck: Konami's Spirits series was one of the first baseball games available for the Xbox 360.
results.name: Pro Yakyuu Spirits 3

results.deck: Atari Anthology is a collection of over 80 Atari games released in 2003 as Atari - 80 Classic Games in One! for Microsoft Windows, and in 2004 for the Xbox and PlayStation 2
results.name: Atari Anthology

results.deck: Four level, side scrolling platformer for PS2, based on the Nickelodeon cartoon, "El Tigre"
results.name: El Tigre: The Adventures of Manny Rivera

results.deck: It's like Muppet Babies with claws! THQ is turning this animated series into a game for DS, Wii, PSP, and PS2.
results.name: Marvel Super Hero Squad

results.deck: FIFA 10 is EA Sports' 2009-2010 edition of the successful football game franchise.
results.name: FIFA 10

results.deck: Metropolismania is a city-building / tycoon title that is comparable to games like RollerCoaster Tycoon in that it requires you to build your play area from scratch.
results.name: Metropolismania

results.deck: Metropolismania 2 is the sequel to the original Metropolismania, and continues in the city-building / tycoon genre by asking players to create metropolitan cities one building at a time.
results.name: Metropolismania 2

results.deck: The second game of the "Gundam vs" series, AEUG vs. Titans covers the Gryps Conflict (the story of Mobile Suit Zeta Gundam).
results.name: Mobile Suit Zeta Gundam: AEUG vs. Titans

results.deck: Gundam SEED: Rengou (Alliance) vs Z.A.F.T. is the fourth game of the "Gundam vs" series. It covers the plot of Gundam SEED.
results.name: Mobile Suit Gundam SEED: Rengou vs. Z.A.F.T.

results.deck: The fifth game of the "Gundam vs" series, Alliance vs Z.A.F.T. II is an arcade action game, notably featuring mobile suits from Gundam SEED and its sequel Gundam SEED Destiny.
results.name: Mobile Suit Gundam SEED Destiny: Rengou vs. Z.A.F.T. II

results.deck: Summer Athletics is back with the 2009 edition
results.name: Summer Athletics 2009

results.deck: Based off the Pixar film, Cars
results.name: Cars: Race-O-Rama

results.deck: An arcade light-gun shooter with a camera to detect player movement, allowing the player to use body movement to hide behind cover and dodge the (slow-moving) bullets. It was the first video game with fairly accurate full-body motion detection, and probably the only one with a motion-controlled cover system.
results.name: Police 911

results.deck: The eleventh game of the SmackDown! games developed by Yuke's Co.
results.name: WWE SmackDown! vs. RAW 2010

results.deck: The second game of Super Robot Wars's "Scramble Commander" subseries. It is a real-time strategy game, unlike the rest of the franchise.
results.name: Super Robot Wars Scramble Commander the 2nd

results.deck: Play as six Ice Age characters as they embark on a rescue mission across melting snow to the mysterious Dinosaur World.
results.name: Ice Age: Dawn of the Dinosaurs

results.deck: NBA 2K10 is the 11th installment in the series and is to be released on October 6, 2009.
results.name: NBA 2K10

results.deck: Hard Hitter Tennis, known as Magical Sports: Hard Hitter in Japan and Center Court: Hard Hitter in Europe, was a tennis game published by Atlus Co. in the USA/Japan and Midas Interactive Entertainment Ltd in Europe. The game was originally created by Japanese developer Magical Company.
results.name: Hard Hitter Tennis

results.deck: An North American-exclusive fighting game that is based on Mobile Suit Gundam SEED. It is a heavily-modified version of an action game that did not see an international release.
results.name: Battle Assault 3 featuring Gundam SEED

results.deck: The newest hockey game from 2K Sports has Washington Capitals star Alexander Ovechkin as cover athlete for the 10th anniversary edition of the game.
results.name: NHL 2K10

results.deck: Manage your own soccer team in this simulation from Eidos.
results.name: Championship Manager 2007

results.deck: Climax U.C. is a game that allows the player to relive several battles throughout Gundam's "Universal Century" timeline.
results.name: Mobile Suit Gundam: Climax U.C.

results.deck: Ape Escape: Million Monkeys pits players against mech-equipped monkeys in real Japanese locations.
results.name: Ape Escape: Million Monkeys

results.deck: Bakugan Battle Brawlers is the multi-platform video game tie-in into the popular Japanese Action adventure cartoon of the same name.  It is a thematic hybrid between a card battle cartoon (e.g., Yu-Gi-Oh) and a creature collecting/battle cartoon (e.g., Pokemon, Digimon).
results.name: Bakugan Battle Brawlers

results.deck: Timber is an arcade game manufactured by Midway in 1984.
results.name: Timber

results.deck: Kamen Rider: Climax Heroes is the first in a series of Kamen Rider fighting games that spans many of the series' generations.
results.name: Kamen Rider: Climax Heroes

results.deck: A  RGG-tinged football management with a penchant for exclamation points. It is centred around the 06/07 soccer season in 10 different countries. It was released by Sega and Konami in Europe on August 25, 2006.
results.name: Let's Make a Soccer Team!

results.deck: Board Games Gallery (10 Games)
results.name: Board Games Gallery (10 Games)

results.deck: Krome Studios's PS2/Wii action game released to coincide with the film of the same name.
results.name: Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen

results.deck: Next Generation Tennis is a tennis sports game that featured the licenses of the Roland Garros and The US Open tournaments.
results.name: Next Generation Tennis

results.deck: The third game in the Atelier series.
results.name: Lilie no Atelier: Salburg no Renkinjutsushi 3

results.deck: The fourth game in the Atelier series.
results.name: Judie no Atelier: Gramnad no Renkinjutsushi

results.deck: The fifth game in the Atelier series.
results.name: Violet no Atelier: Gramnad no Renkinjutsushi 2

results.deck: THQ's youth-oriented adaptation of the Disney/Pixar film of the same name.
results.name: Up

results.deck: The newest addition to the Buzz! Junior series, the game takes on a space theme.
results.name: Buzz! Junior: Robo Jam

results.deck: The 8th installment of the Tantei Jinguuji Saburo (Jake Hunter) series, and the first to be developed by WorkJam. Jingūji is asked to search for a missing daughter from the director of a hospital where he had received treatment. This small case gradually expands to revive a deep and complex mystery.
results.name: Tantei Jinguuji Saburo: Innocent Black

results.deck: The 9th installment of the Tantei Jinguuji Saburo (Jake Hunter) series. Jingūji is bored and tired after several months without any cases. He gladly returns to work when the Kantō mafia requests the investigation of a certain individual.
results.name: Tantei Jinguuji Saburo: Kind of Blue

results.deck: Splashdown: Rides Gone Wild is a jet-ski racing game and sequel to the 2001 PS2 and Xbox game, developed by Rainbow Studios and published by THQ.
results.name: Splashdown: Rides Gone Wild

results.deck: Konami's second attempt at a skateboarding game.
results.name: Evolution Skateboarding

results.deck: A game from the Bleach series. Released in japan in 2005.
results.name: Bleach: Erabareshi Tamashii

results.deck: The long awaited sequel to Theme Park by Electronic Arts.
results.name: Sim Theme Park

results.deck: The latest addition to the Melty Blood series, released in Japanese arcades on September 18, 2008. A PS2 version of the game was released in Japan on August 20, 2009.
results.name: Melty Blood: Actress Again

results.deck: Fight for the freedom of all magical creatures and save your race the dragons from extinction. Play as Cael Cyndar and with him control the elements of fire, water, wind and earth. This game was originally to be called "Dragon Wars of Might and Magic".
results.name: Dragon Rage

results.deck: Naruto Shippuden: Ultimate Ninja 5 is the 5th installment in the Ultimate Ninja series.
results.name: Naruto Shippuden: Ultimate Ninja 5

results.deck: The next instalment in the popular karaoke game series. It features songs from  the British boy band Take That.
results.name: SingStar: Take That

results.deck: Saint Seiya: The Sanctuary ties in 3D fighting with storylines from the Saint Seiya manga series and cut scenes from the anime.
results.name: Saint Seiya: The Sanctuary

results.deck: A 3D fighting game with characters and storylines from the Saint Seiya franchise.
results.name: Saint Seiya: The Hades

results.deck: The second and last Tear Ring Saga game.
results.name: Tear Ring Saga: Berwick Saga

results.deck: A role-playing game by Vanpool.
results.name: Endonesia

results.deck: Build your own 3D fighting game using customizable 3D models, moves, body types, camera angles, and more.
results.name: Fighter Maker 2

results.deck: Konami tries its hand at pro basketball on the PS2 and Xbox.
results.name: NBA Starting Five

results.deck: A proposed second sequel to the PS1 hit Fear Effect was shown at E3 2002, but after many delays, was ultimately cancelled by Eidos.
results.name: Fear Effect: Inferno

results.deck: Acclaim's attempt to revive the classic arcade game for PS2 and Xbox.
results.name: NBA Jam

results.deck: Acclaim brings 4-on-4 street soccer to the PS2 and PC.  This version was released only in Europe.
results.name: Urban Freestyle Soccer

results.deck: Choose from one of 320 Division I schools and enter the 30 year dynasty mode.
results.name: NCAA March Madness 2004

results.deck: Konami brings the world of MMA to PS2 with 20 real fighters, all of whom lent their talents to motion capture for the game.
results.name: K-1 World Grand Prix

results.deck: This Dead to Rights spin-off was canceled before release.  It followed an honest cop named Santini in the middle of an undercover investigation.
results.name: Extreme Force: Grant City Anti-Crime

results.deck: A strategy RPG for the PlayStation 2.
results.name: Coloball 2002

results.deck: Finny the Fish & the Seven Waters is a PS2 game where the player plays as Finny the Fish and must help him save the land from great danger. Player will make their way through perilous waters, fight enemies, dodge fishermen and eat up lots of fish food to succeed!
results.name: Finny the Fish & the Seven Waters

results.deck: An action RPG from Square-Enix released only in Japan.
results.name: Code Age Commanders

results.deck: This unreleased title, a continuation of the Sega Genesis Vectorman series, was announced in 2003 and shown at E3 '03, before being quietly cancelled for seemingly no reason.
results.name: Vectorman

results.deck: Sony's college football franchise for the 2003 season.
results.name: NCAA GameBreaker 2004

results.deck: Tecmo's horse racing franchise brings over 2500 new steeds and 30 tracks to this installment.
results.name: Gallop Racer 2003: A New Breed

results.deck: This survival horror title was cancelled two months after it was unveiled at E3 2004.
results.name: Dead Rush

results.deck: The Bratz girls hit the red carpet as they rock out in explosive music shows, strut the fashion runway with stylin' outfits designed by you, and publish the hottest magazine ever. Their hard work lands them a once in a lifetime opportunity to star in their very own movie.
results.name: Bratz: The Movie

results.deck: Bethesda brings 50 vehicles, 24 pro drivers, and 11 sanctioned tracks to the 2005 edition of their drag racing franchise.
results.name: IHRA Professional Drag Racing 2005

results.deck: Sony's soccer franchise continues.
results.name: World Tour Soccer 2005

results.deck: An action game based on the movie, which is based on the popular children's book.
results.name: Zathura

results.deck: Bethesda's drag racing franchise for 2006.
results.name: IHRA Drag Racing: Sportsman Edition

results.deck: Set to coincide with the 30th anniversary of the film, Majesco's Taxi Driver game was unfortunately canceled amidst financial problems in late 2005.
results.name: Taxi Driver

results.deck: Namco's street bike franchise goes online with 16 tracks and real riders exclusively for PS2.
results.name: MotoGP4

results.deck: This canceled FPS was planned to tell an untold story during Season 8 of the television show.  Development stopped in late 2006.  A legal battle then ensued between JoWood and Perception over the rights to the franchise.
results.name: Stargate SG-1: The Alliance

results.deck: Arcade style fishing comes to the PS2.
results.name: Mark Davis Pro Bass Challenge

results.deck: Rock Band Metal Track Pack is a standalone game that packages up 20 metal songs from Rock Band's library.  It includes songs from Black Tide, Judas Priest, Rage Against The Machine, and more.
results.name: Rock Band: Metal Track Pack

results.deck: An adventure game for the PS2 developed by Dimple Entertainment.
results.name: Loveroot Zero: Kiss Kiss * Labyrinth

results.deck: Myth Makers Super Kart GP is a kart racer game for the PC that was released in January of 2006, which was then ported to the Nintendo Wii in November of 2007. In either single player, time trial or tournament modes, you compete in a racing game that involves eight drivers, eight vehicles, a multitude of tracks and a variety of special power-ups for use against your AI opponents.
results.name: Myth Makers Super Kart GP

results.deck: An all new for 2009 hunting and fishing game.
results.name: Cabela's Outdoor Adventures

results.deck: Join three friends in 10 real bowling locations and journey from amateur to tour pro.
results.name: Brunswick Pro Bowling

results.deck: Create your own princess and set forth on a journey to restore order to the Disney kingdoms.
results.name: Disney Princess: Enchanted Journey

results.deck: Travel across America as one of the six characters from High School Musical or create a new star of your own.
results.name: High School Musical: Makin' the Cut!

results.deck: Edutainment title that teaches kids about letters and basic spelling.
results.name: Konami Kids Playground: Alphabet Circus

results.deck: Edutainment game that teaches kids about shapes and colors with the help of friendly dinosaurs.
results.name: Konami Kids Playground: Dinosaurs Shapes and Colors

results.deck: Edutainment game that teaches kids the value of exercise with the help of the classic arcade character, Frogger.
results.name: Konami Kids Playground: Frogger Hop, Skip & Jumpin' Fun

results.deck: Edutainment game that teaches kids about numbers with the help of friendly Toy Pals.
results.name: Konami Kids Playground: Toy Pals Fun with Numbers

results.deck: Secret Saturdays: Beasts of the 5th Sun is a video game based on the Cartoon Network Series the Secret Saturdays.
results.name: The Secret Saturdays: Beasts of the 5th Sun

results.deck: Backyard Football '08 is one in a series of fun, non-sim style sports titles from Atari. It features cartoon-style graphics and simple football gameplay.
results.name: Backyard Football '08

results.deck: A high-school romance based visual novel for the PS2 and Xbox 360, developed and published by 5pb.
results.name: Memories Off 6: T-Wave
